alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued May 25 at 12:10PM ChST until May 26 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CHST FRIDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet in the surf zone along south and west facing reefs. Expect life-threatening rip currents. * WHERE...Tinian and Saipan Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 6 PM ChST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Shoreline erosion will occur along with the possibility of inundation for coastal properties.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
